metadata.Title: CVE-2018-16888 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
It was discovered systemd does not correctly check the content of PIDFile files before using it to kill processes. When a service is run from an unprivileged user (e.g. User field set in the service file), a local attacker who is able to write to the PIDFile of the mentioned service may use this flaw to trick systemd into killing other services and/or privileged processes. Versions before v237 are vulnerable.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16888` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 229-4ubuntu21.27
libnss-mymachines - 229-4ubuntu21.27
libnss-resolve - 229-4ubuntu21.27
libpam-systemd - 229-4ubuntu21.27
libsystemd0 - 229-4ubuntu21.27
libudev1 - 229-4ubuntu21.27
systemd - 229-4ubuntu21.27
systemd-container - 229-4ubuntu21.27
systemd-coredump - 229-4ubuntu21.27
systemd-journal-remote - 229-4ubuntu21.27
systemd-sysv - 229-4ubuntu21.27
udev - 229-4ubuntu21.27
No subscription required

criterions.comment: systemd package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '229-4ubuntu21.27').
